artist: Kiki Smith; Printer and publisher: Universal Limited Art Editions (ULAE)
image_copyright: © 1992 Kiki Smith/ Universal Limited Art Editions
markings:
Numbered in pencil, LL: 34/50
Publisher's blindstamp, LRC: ULAE (intertwined)
medium: Photogravure on machine-made paper, photogravure, etching, and aquatint on ivory Japanese paper, with ivory Japanese paper cutouts, twisted-paper addtions, and paper strings, mounted on black Japanese paper with cutouts
provenance: Private collection, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2011.
text: Kiki Smith has explored ideas of mortality, decay, and femininity through images of the body—usually her own. Here, she has dissected photographs of herself to create a worm-like figure, emerging below a body contorted into the fetal position and framed by a rectangle. Is the shape constricting or comforting her? The curled figure is a photographic negative, creating an unnatural glow that dissolves the face and hands—as though the body were decaying into light.
title: Worm
